Replace.Text: An Shan

The first of the ‘Four Greats’ of Dragon Empery, the first ship of the An Shan-class destroyers. An Shan, one of the world's longest-distance destroyers, has the most outstanding courage and determination to face all enemies. For the sake of the motherland, go forward! Your sisters are waiting for you on the Bohai Sea with its reddish haze.
Everyone, regroup. We can't retreat like this!
An Shan will rely on the AnSteel to forge her victories.

For An Shan, her strong industrial zone can provide her with a constant supply of [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron and [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminium, which can be turned into a powerful driving force for the city's development. Therefore, it became the best choice for An Shan to develop Iron Working as soon as possible and popularise Ansteel in the city. An Shan will then gain a lot of [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture from the construction of the city. If any civilisation wants to try and conquer An Shan's cities, don't worry! An Shan's units will quickly even out the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength gap and will quickly gain upgrades in battle. An Shan is very tricky for any civilisation. Under An Shan's guardianship, Dragon Empery will become the greatest nation in the world.

On 12 October 1954, two destroyers, two minesweepers and two mini-submarines sold by the USSR to China under the Agreement on Naval Delivery and Technical Assistance to China in the Construction of Warships arrived in Qingdao, and on 26 October, the Chinese side held a signing ceremony for the handover of the ships and a flag-naming ceremony at the No. 3 dock of Qingdao Dagang. According to the order of the Central Military Commission, the destroyer Leshchiney was named Naval Ship An Shan, with the port number 101 (soon to be changed to 301), and its first captain, Su Jun, and political commissar, Liu Chengzhang, were appointed.

In November 1955, An Shan participated in the anti-landing exercise on Liaodong Peninsula with Fu Shun, assumed the task of guarding and fire support for the blue landing formation, and at the same time acted as the commanding ship and accepted the chief's inspection. 4 August 1957, participated in the naval parade held in Jiaozhou Bay, Qingdao, to commemorate the 30th anniversary of the founding of the People's Liberation Army, and acted as the flagship of the parade in which Premier Zhou Enlai rode. 1959, in May, the ship moved to the south to participate in the landing exercise on the Peninsula organized by the Nanjing Military Region. In May 1959, she went south to take part in the landing manoeuvres on the Peninsula organised by the Nanjing Military Region, where she rehearsed such subjects as fire support to the shore and combating the ‘enemy’ maritime convoys, etc. In September 1961, her port number was changed to 201.

Between 14 and 22 April 1962, An Shan, together with Chang Chun, Tai Yuan and two minesweepers and one submarine, maintained a formation of two destroyers and one minesweeper (submarine) for eight days to monitor the U.S.S. Di Haiwen, which operated outside China's territorial waters off Qingdao and issued a serious warning against its intrusion into China's territorial waters. From 29 September to 5 October 1963, in conjunction with the Fu Shun, the U.S. Navy destroyer Brewer was under surveillance off the Shandong and Liaodong Peninsulas to monitor the U.S. Navy destroyer Brewer, which had come close to China for reconnaissance during China's National Day.

From November 1973 to October 1974, An Shan entered Dalian Shipyard for missile modification in combination with minor repairs, and in November 1974, two missile target tests were completed, thus the modification of the Type 07 destroyer to the ‘Upstream No. 1’ missile project was fully completed. In the same year, the port number was changed to 101.

On 9 May 1977, An Shan and Fu Shun went south to take part in ‘Project 7713’ (salvage of Japanese shipwreck Awa Maru) to cover the mission, and arrived at the operation area near Niushan Island, Pingtan County, Fujian Province on the 23rd. They returned to Qingdao on 22 July, lasting 75 days, including 56 days of continuous sailing and anchoring, which set a record for Type 07 destroyers.

On 21 February 1992, An Shan was decommissioned, and on 24 April a flag-lowering ceremony was held at the Qingdao Guzhenkou Navy Pier. In October of that year, it succeeded Chang Chun in the maritime exhibition area of the Qingdao Naval Museum, where it is on display until today.
Loong's Dance

Units will gain a promotion level after killing an enemy unit. Gain [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to 20% of the construction cost when finishing Buildings. Units with [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength gain the "Loong's Dance" Unit Command.
Ansteel

An Shan unique district, replacing Industrial Zone district, unlock earlier, cost less. [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production Adjacent Bonus also provides [ICON_SCIENCE] Science. Awards 2 [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron and [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminium. +50% adjacency bonus for adjacent Ansteel, with additional 1 [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron and [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminium.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from each adjacent districts, +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from adjacent Strategic resources. Provides +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for adjacent Mines.

An Shan unique district, replacing Industrial Zone district, unlock earlier, cost less. [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production Adjacent Bonus also provides [ICON_SCIENCE] Science. Provides 4 [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron and [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminium per turn, Strategic Resource Stockpiles increased +10 (on Standard Speed). +50% adjacency bonus for adjacent Ansteel, with additional 1 [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron and [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminium per turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Allows cities to consume [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron and [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminium to provide [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for current production.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from each adjacent districts, +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from adjacent Strategic resources. Provides +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for adjacent Mines.
+{1_num} [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from each adjacent {1_Num : plural 1?district; other?districts;}.
+{1_num} [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from the adjacent Strategic {1_Num : plural 2?resource; other?resources;}.
+{1_num} [ICON_SCIENCE] Science from each adjacent Ansteel {1_Num : plural 2?district; other?districts;}.
+{Property} from Loong's Dance
Loong's Dance

Limited to once per turn, this unit gains [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus for the turn, as the difference between the highest Base Combat Strength of an adjacent unit and its own Base Combat Strength.
Will gain {1_num} [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus

Consuming [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron provides [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to the city's current production. Each point of [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron provides {1_num} [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and doubles the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production provided when providing [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to a Buildings or Districts.
Completion of {1_Name} production requires {2_num} {2_num : plural 1?point; other?points;} [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron to provide {3_num} [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.

Consuming [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminium provides [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for the city's current production. Each point of [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminium provides {1_num} [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, doubling the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production provided when providing [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to a Units or Projects.
Completion of {1_Name} production requires {2_num} {2_num : plural 1?point; other?points;} [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminium to provide {3_num} [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
[COLOR_RED]Unit does not exist.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_RED]This command has already been used by the unit this turn.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_RED]Unable to get [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_RED]The city does not exist.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_RED]Ansteel has been pillaged.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_RED]This city is not currently producing anything.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_RED]There are not enough [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_RED]There are not enough [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminium.[ENDCOLOR]
The Dragon Empery has added your nation to our friendly list. May our cooperation be as steady as the Bohai Sea.
Apologies, the hawthorn trees in Bohai Bay are in bloom. Let's discuss this another time...
As a ship that has sailed over 100,000 nautical miles, I understand the value of allies. Would you consider establishing friendly relations with the Dragon Empery?
Excellent, Tai Yuan and the others will be delighted to hear this news.
Understood... That's quite alright...
The Four Unbreakables have never feared confrontation! The Dragon Empery will not be humiliated again!
I must protect my sisters... and everything they cherish. The Dragon Empery declares war on you!
The Dragon Empery has prepared for the reception. They will visit the peaceful Bohai Bay. When the sea turns red under the sunset, it's truly magnificent...
Our apologies, we're currently conducting joint fleet exercises. Perhaps next season...
The Dragon Empery's delegation will bring special Anshan pears. Please... oh, that's not me, but a beautiful city at the foot of Qianshan Mountains...
What is your purpose in making such accusations? Alas, this will only sadden my sisters...
Even Fu Shun would shake her head at your actions! (Condemn you)

I am the An Shan, lead ship of the An Shan-class destroyers and first of the Dragon Empery's "Four Unbreakables". Though without combat experience, I've participated in numerous exercises, surveillance missions, and standoffs, achieving commendable results. I hope our exchanges will be as magnificent as the Yellow Sea.
My city is nearby, with history as ancient as the Dragon Empery itself. Would you like to visit? I'll take you to Xianrentai to admire the magnificent Qianshan scenery.
Thank you, Fu Shun will definitely want to hear about this!
Let our cooperation begin with exchanging the locations of our capitals!
What would you like to know?
It's not easy to sound the horn of peace. You've worked hard.
You're nothing more than another "De Haven" - I've seen your kind before.
Our cooperation will shape a bright future. Will you form an alliance with the Dragon Empery?
My sisters will be pleased to see this.
We will not retreat!
This war has long lost its meaning. Let us lay down our weapons and sound the horn of peace together.
The Dragon Empery opens its borders to you. May our magnificent landscapes uplift your spirits.
The Dragon Empery will not allow anyone with ill intentions to cross our borders!
To safeguard peace, we need to cross your borders. Do you accept?
I witnessed similar scenes back in 1962. To avoid unpleasantness, withdraw your troops immediately!
The Dragon Empery's routine patrols will not be disturbed.
Apologies for the concern. The Dragon Empery's forces will withdraw shortly.
At least... ensure my sisters... evacuate safely...
This won't do.
This might be nice for a change.
